text.text:
Had a business trip to chennai and stayed in this hotel.
Easy access to Airport. 20 - 30min drive.
Great complimentary breakfast. Quick room service. Rooms are spacious and cozy. All room controls are given through ipad.
Best stay a person could ask for.

editorialSummary.text: Polished quarters in an upmarket hotel with restaurants & a nightclub, plus a spa & an outdoor pool.

text.text:
The hotel is old. The rooms are small, beds are of avg size.  Do not expect a new and spacious bathroom and modern styles.
The rooms were clean and service was good. The location is just next to the US consulate. Both biometric and consulate are walkable.
Overall a good stay for 2-3 days.

originalText.text:
The hotel is old. The rooms are small, beds are of avg size.  Do not expect a new and spacious bathroom and modern styles.
The rooms were clean and service was good. The location is just next to the US consulate. Both biometric and consulate are walkable.

text.text:
The hotel effectively aligns its pricing with the amenities it offers, creating a harmonious balance. The establishment boasts a pleasing ambiance that enhances the overall guest experience. However, a notable drawback is the presence of only two elevators, both of which operate at a relatively sluggish pace. This can be inconvenient, as extended wait times ensue if one of the elevators halts, affecting the timely access to different floors.

The rooms are well-appointed, contributing positively to the overall impression of the stay. Nonetheless, there is a discernible discrepancy in the bathroom size in relation to the generous dimensions of the rooms. The bathrooms may be perceived as somewhat cramped compared to the spaciousness offered in the rest of the room. Despite this minor concern, the hotel's favorable pricing strategy, coupled with its commendable facilities and inviting atmosphere, contributes to a generally positive assessment. Addressing the elevator speed and bathroom size could further elevate the guest experience and ensure a more seamless stay.

text.text: This was one of the worst hotels stays I have had. First of all, this is NOT a 5 star hotel. Maybe it once was but it cannot claim to be one anymore. I don't know of any 5 star hotels that don't have running hot water. I had to call someone from reception when I needed hot water for a bath and someone brought hot water in a bucket with a mug!! There was a musty moldy unpleasant smell throughout the hotel. The first room I got had such a strong smell of mold and the bathrooms smelled of sewage so I asked for a room change. The rooms are super old and in need of an update. Nearly all the pieces of furniture are scuffed, chipped and damaged. My bed linen was stained as was the chair in the room. Cleanliness is not at all a priority at the park. There was dirt and grime on the corners of the room, the windows had not been cleaned in ages and the carpets in the halls were littered with matchsticks and little pieces of trash. There were towels soaking up water on the floor in some places in the hallway. The worst part was that I got very sick from the food after ordering room service in the night. I was up throwing up all night because of it.  The chef and staff very apologetic about this later which I appreciate.  The breakfast spread was also decent. Everything is super over priced though including the food, the shuttle service(Rs. 2200 for airport v/s Rs.360 on OLA) and the room itself. It is worth less than half that in my opinion. My understanding is that the only reason this place continues to operate is because of its proximity to the US consulate.  It is a short walk away and was super convenient. However, the convenience was not worth the hit in comfort of stay and I will never be staying in this hotel again even if I have work at the consulate. Save your money and stay some place else and invest the money in cab fare.

editorialSummary.text: Atrium hotel with polished rooms & multiple dining options, plus 2 lounges, outdoor pools & a spa.

text.text:
I wanted to express my heartfelt gratitude for the exceptional experience during my recent stay on February 2024 at your hotel. From the moment I arrived, I felt welcomed and valued. The room provided was not only comfortable but exceeded my expectations in terms of amenities and cleanliness.

The breakfast spread was truly amazing, offering a delightful start to my day. However, what truly stood out was the impeccable service provided by Mr. Sathish, the hotel's Airport representative. He went above and beyond to ensure that my airport transfer was smooth and comfortable, providing valuable recommendations for local attractions.

Thanks to the wonderful hospitality and service received, I am already looking forward to my next visit. Hyatt Regency Chennai has truly set the standard for excellence, and I will not hesitate to recommend it to colleagues and friends.

for the price of stay and stature of a 4 star hotel - i must say it doesn't quite do justice.

text.text:
One of the oldest and iconic hotels in Chennai (actually Madras, considering it more represents that era than the present). While still fairly well maintained and complete with most amenities & luxuries, the hotel is sort off showing it's age. It looks a tad worn out and dated (low ceilings, old fashioned furniture, etc.), that said it's still clean, fairly well appointed, and has functional amenities.
That said, the location and breakfast is very good. And the accomodation at fair rates is a very good value for money proposition.

text.text:
Hilton Chennai exceeded all expectations for a memorable stay. The modern, welcoming atmosphere and comfortable yet sophisticated rooms set the tone. The staff's friendliness and proactive assistance made me feel truly valued.

Dining was a highlight, with a diverse and delicious breakfast spread and exceptional on-site restaurants. The amenities, including a well-equipped fitness center and a refreshing pool, added to the overall experience.

The hotel's strategic location made it easy to explore the city, making Hilton Chennai a standout choice for a luxurious and convenient stay. Highly recommended for both business and leisure travelers.

text.text: Old property, totally not recommended, please don't go there. We were shocked to see the services and property when we stayed there for 5 days. text.text:
We booked this hotel with high hopes and all false promises made by the  Sales manager .
When we arrived the rooms were not ready , we were handed over the room with stink and items used by previous occupant .
Food was laid out as if it is a some kind of 2 star hotel . I think some Oyo room would have provide a better conduct of food layout . Staff was unprofessional and ill  trained .
Next day after complaint things were made bit better , however layout and variety improved a bit …
We stayed there for 5 nights and each night menu remained almost same with only one choice in vegetable .
Bills were not prepared timely and we had to wait whole night for same .
Before checkout we had provided advance info that we would require early packed breakfast . Which was also not provided in time .
There were many more minute unprofessional issues in the hotel — laundry clothes , hygiene n sanitation of washroom , cobwebs in rooms etc .
Hotel will show u pics of new building and allot you rooms in old building .
We tried to reach Mr Nair the GM but he seems to be the busiest man . After consistent effort finally we could get his time ie 0930 hours , for which he never turned up and didn’t think of giving courtesy call to express his inability to meet .
There are better hotels around which might give you a bit less facilities but are much better in customer service .
Will never recommend anyone to stay at this hotels not even my enemies .

text.text:
Good hotel, with all amenities one may ask for. It is clean and comfortable - upholds the IHG reputation. I was very well supported by the Concierge Desk - so a Big Thanks to them.
The lobby is a bit confusing as it's partly hidden behind the front decorations.
And the breakfast spread wasn't really what one should expect from IHG. Also the breakfast layout was disappointing - as if it was a treasure hunt to find some items (which were either behind big pillars, or at a corner or few in another room altogether). Live Desk was good but slow.

But barring few hiccups, overall it was a good experience.

editorialSummary.text: Contemporary hotel featuring free breakfast & Wi-Fi, plus a cigar lounge, an outdoor pool & a spa.

text.text: I stayed here in 2022 for 4 days. The rooms are very well maintained. The breakfast buffet was delightful with several yummy and healthy options, including dishes from the live counter and fresh filter coffee. Our checkin and checkout experience was not smooth. The front desk staff displayed little knowledge and awareness. Moreover I booked for airport pickup and the staff who handled my booking over the phone was quite rude. The airport pickup itself went very well. I also used the salon services for a haircut and it was very good. Overall a very good hotel but the front desk service is rather poor and not at par with counterparts in other locations such as New Delhi.

text.text:
The staff at this hotel are second-to-none. Very friendly and helpful. The room was opulent and spacious and the shower was hot and high pressure. I would recommend you turn the AC off in the room because it can make the room too cold. The pool on the roof is very refreshing and the steam room good for clearing out your sinuses. It would be nice if you could get a cup of coffee on the roof.
I should also say that you can get a proper espresso in the lobby, although you will pay through the nose for it.

My recent stay at the Holiday Inn Chennai was nothing short of fantastic. From the moment I stepped into the hotel, I knew I was in for a memorable experience.

The rooms were not only comfortable but also meticulously clean and well-maintained. The bed was incredibly cozy, and I had a wonderful night's sleep. The room's amenities and modern decor added to the overall appeal.

One of the highlights of my stay was the exceptional dining options. The hotel's restaurant offered a diverse range of delicious dishes, catering to various tastes. The breakfast spread was particularly impressive, offering a wide selection of both local and international cuisine.

Whether you're in Chennai for business or leisure, the Holiday Inn's location is ideal.It's a hotel that combines luxury with exceptional service, and I'm already looking forward to my next stay. Thank you for making my trip to Chennai an unforgettable one!

text.text:
The Courtyard by Marriott hotel in Chennai offers a comfortable and convenient stay but falls short in a few aspects that could have enhanced the overall guest experience.

While the hotel boasts a prime location and modern amenities, a couple of areas could be improved to elevate the stay. Firstly, although the rooms are clean and well-appointed, some aspects felt slightly dated or in need of refurbishment. A fresher and more contemporary design could enhance the ambiance and add a more modern touch to the accommodation.

Additionally, while the hotel staff members were generally courteous and accommodating, there were occasional lapses in the promptness of service. Improving the responsiveness and efficiency in addressing guest requests or inquiries would elevate the level of service provided.

Furthermore, the dining options, although offering a decent variety, could benefit from more diverse and innovative menu selections. Enhancing the culinary offerings with a wider range of local and international flavors might further elevate the dining experience for guests staying at the Courtyard by Marriott Chennai.

Moreover, while the hotel's facilities are adequate, some guests might appreciate additional recreational amenities or activities within the premises to enrich their stay, such as more extensive fitness facilities or organized leisure activities.

In conclusion, while the Courtyard by Marriott Chennai offers a comfortable and generally satisfying stay, attention to updating certain elements of the rooms, enhancing service responsiveness, diversifying dining choices, and possibly expanding on-site amenities could significantly improve the overall guest experience and elevate the hotel to even greater heights of excellence.

Enhancing the culinary offerings with a wider range of local and international flavors might further elevate the dining experience for guests staying at the Courtyard by Marriott Chennai.

Moreover, while the hotel's facilities are adequate, some guests might appreciate additional recreational amenities or activities within the premises to enrich their stay, such as more extensive fitness facilities or organized leisure activities.

In conclusion, while the Courtyard by Marriott Chennai offers a comfortable and generally satisfying stay, attention to updating certain elements of the rooms, enhancing service responsiveness, diversifying dining choices, and possibly expanding on-site amenities could significantly improve the overall guest experience and elevate the hotel to even greater heights of excellence.

text.text:
The LEE ROYAL MÉRIDIEN Chennai is quite a luxurious hotel with stylish suite-style rooms. I must say, the road-facing rooms deserve a solid 10 stars for their elegance and comfort.

I must mention the housekeeping staff, who were not only friendly but also diligent in their work. There was one standout staff member,, who seemed to understand my preferences exceptionally well. He noticed that I preferred using the sofa cushions instead of the regular big pillows they place on the bed. Without me even asking, he switched them out for another pillow with the same height as the sofa cushion. It's this kind of attention to detail and excellent service that truly sets this hotel apart..

I highly appreciate the entire staff here; they are genuinely nice people. This hotel provides an exceptional experience that I wholeheartedly recommend.

editorialSummary.text: Upmarket hotel featuring multiple eateries & a bar, plus a spa, a gym & a rooftop pool.

text.text: I stayed with them for a night, last week. Firstly, this is definitely not a 5 star property. At best a 2.5/3.0 star hotel. The rooms are not well appointed, they can definitely take the cleanliness a notch or two above. We were assured of an early check-in, however much to our disappointment, they denied us the same. The executive who had advised us of the early check-in was no where to be seen.  They can do better on improving their internal and external communications. I wish they'd keep their word and offer a better customer experience. Since we had some time to kill, we observed that the lobby/reception area was rather dull and gloomy.  We discovered that our room's door lock got jammed in the middle of night though they attended to it, they removed the lock completely, it was ok with us as we were 2 gents, it could be problematic if there were female guests. Would I consider them again? probably not. Overall, I'm not impressed, they can do much better.

editorialSummary.text: Bright rooms & suites in a polished hotel with rooftop dining & an outdoor pool.

text.text:
During my recent visit to Feathers A Radha Hotel, situated on the bustling Mount Poonamallee Rd, Manapakkam, Chennai, I found myself enveloped in the comfort of well-maintained and aesthetically pleasing rooms. This aspect of the hotel truly stood out, highlighting the establishment's dedication to ensuring a pleasant stay for its guests. However, despite the commendable accommodations, the hotel's pricing strategy raised eyebrows. The cost, in my opinion, lacked a clear justification, especially when considering the overall value offered.
Dining within the hotel presented a mixed experience. The hotel houses several restaurants, yet the culinary journey did not meet the expectations set by the room's luxury. The food was average at best, struggling to justify the exorbitant prices attached. This was particularly disappointing as the taste failed to impress, leaving much to be desired from the dining experience. In a city celebrated for its vibrant culinary scene, the offerings at Feathers A Radha Hotel felt underwhelming.
The service was satisfactory, with staff members showing a decent level of attentiveness and efficiency. Additionally, the hotel serves as a venue for birthday parties, indicating its capability to cater to special events and gatherings. This versatility is a positive note, suggesting that while there are areas in need of improvement, the hotel does strive to accommodate diverse guest needs.
Feathers A Radha Hotel shines in its accommodations but falls short in providing a dining experience that matches the high standards of its rooms and services. The discrepancy between cost and value, particularly in the culinary offerings, is a significant area for reflection and improvement.

editorialSummary.text: Warm rooms & suites in a refined hotel with pan-Asian dining, a 24/7 coffee shop & an outdoor pool.

text.text:
A Remarkable Stay at Ramada Hotel, Chennai: Excellence Redefined

My recent stay at the Ramada Hotel in Chennai was nothing short of extraordinary. From the moment I stepped into the lobby to the time of my departure, every aspect of my experience surpassed my expectations. Allow me to share the highlights of my delightful journey at this remarkable establishment.

First and foremost, the check-in experience was a breeze. It was not just fast; it was superfast! The efficiency and professionalism displayed by the check-in desk staff were commendable. Please convey my heartfelt appreciation to them for their seamless service.

Now, let's talk about the culinary delights that awaited me. The food at Ramada was nothing short of fabulous and sumptuous. I had the pleasure of indulging in their buffet breakfast, lunch, and dinner, and each meal was a gastronomic delight. The variety and quality of dishes surpassed my expectations. What's more, the service staff were warm, attentive, and always ready to assist. Their proactive approach ensured that I never had to wait long for any additional specialties or made-to-order dishes. Please extend my gratitude to the service staff for their exceptional hospitality.

The accommodation provided was equally impressive. The rooms were immaculate, well-maintained, and exuded a sense of calm and relaxation, which was much needed after braving the heat of Chennai. The housekeeping team deserves special mention for their meticulous attention to detail. They not only kept the rooms spotless but also took special care to replenish any items that were running low. Please convey my appreciation to the housekeeping staff for their dedication to ensuring a comfortable stay.
Overall, my stay at Ramada Hotel in Chennai was nothing short of extraordinary. The impeccable service, delectable food, and serene ambiance surpassed all my expectations. Without a doubt, Ramada stands out as one of the best hotels in India, and I can't wait to return for another unforgettable experience.

text.text:
We arrived at 20:45 to check in and after an extremely slow service and lots of waiting we were asked to wait another 15 minutes before going to the room. When I asked if the room was not ready I was told 'yes it is we just want it to be perfect'.

When eventually we were given a key to room 402 there were no coffee mugs and not a single towel. I phoned reception and they responded without any apology, simply with a 'we'll send some up'.

Upon further inspection of the room it was clear that the room had not been cleaned at all since the previous guest. The carpet had food crumbs, hairs and other litter. There was more litter on the table and stains throughout the room and no shower gel or towels.

I went downstairs to inform reception that they had checked us into an uncleaned room. Again I received not a single apology but just 'we will send a cleaning crew right away.'

We waited for any of this to happen and by 23:00 we were still in a filthy room without a single towel so had to, yet again, contact reception. We finally received towels after 11 at night but no cleaning happened and we had to sleep in a dirty room.

I have never had such an appalling experience in any hotel, of any rating. When checking out the next morning I asked for the duty manager and the lady at reception said it was she. I explained everything and complained and all she said was 'We will ensure it doesn't happen to the next guest'. Appalled at this inadequate response I asked to speak with another manager.

The next manager took things a little more seriously and had an excuse that many people had checked out that day. He then comped us our small bar bill.

It's inconceivable to me that a hotel of this reputation would not be ready to check in guest so late in the evening. It is also astonishing that the hotel would check guests into a dirty room. It is unacceptable that having brought this to the attention of reception nothing was done about it. And finally it is beyond surprising that apologies and amends were not forthcoming.

text.text: It's been a week I'm staying here. Very professional hotel staff. Located in prime location. Rooms are pretty decent and rooftop swimming pool is plus point.. And breakfast is yummy. Well maintained. Over all it's very good experience.

text.text:
Visited to Rooftop restaurant for Dinner. Food taste is very good. Service is good. Nice view with Rooftops swimming pool, nice breeze, beautiful night view.

Cost of food is too high. Minimum food price is like ₹500+ even for mocktail drinks.

text.text: Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Chennai offers a luxurious retreat in the heart of the city. The hotel boasts stylish and spacious rooms, equipped with modern amenities to ensure a comfortable stay. Guests can indulge in delicious cuisine at the on-site restaurants, and unwind with a refreshing drink at the bar. With attentive staff and excellent service, Ramada Plaza Chennai guarantees a memorable experience for both business and leisure travelers.

editorialSummary.text: Elegant rooms & suites in a modern hotel offering 3 restaurants, an outdoor pool & a spa.

text.text:
We held our nephews wedding reception here. The staff are very smart. They understood our requirements.

We had a food tasting where the staff and chef worked hand in hand to take in all our feedback. They made it a point that all the feedback was incorporated on the day of the reception.

The staff worked round the clock to keep all our guests happy. They were there ensuring all our guests got their welcome drinks, food was being topped up without delays .

The rest rooms were spotless. The ladies cleaning the ladies restrooms were soft spoken, extremely thorough at their job.

text.text: Great location, close to Phoenix Mall. The hotel and room were beautifully designed with great in-room amenities. Fun children's activities on Sundays. Huge breakfast buffet was a hit but the service staff lacked attention and good training. Food orders took a long time (at least 30 minutes) to arrive. Room service took even longer. Housekeeping was good but they kept pushing for good reviews on TripAdvisor. Definitely room for improvement for the restaurant wait staff.

text.text: Beautiful hotel located on the main road with multicusine and authentic South Indian food at a very affordable price. Food rates don't go above 300 for a dish and they taste really good. They serve it hot too and have a lot of waiters so that service can be done fast. It has very good walking space and parking space. The rates of the rooms are decent too. It's  a worthy a try and it doesn't tear ur pocket too.

text.text:
It’s value for money ! Rooms are clean . Staff polite , they even accommodated by allowing an extension of  our stay by 5 hours because we checked in late without any extra charge. Definitely best option in that area.
Restaurant attached also has very good South Indian food . Meal option is the best. North Indian food was average tasting.
Definitely recommend the place.

text.text:
I have visited this place for my friends marriage reception in New Woodlands Lawn. Lawn can accommodate 200 people, stage decoration also looks good.

This hotel is a iconic hotel in heart of the city. Have good parking space for both cars and bikes.

Lawn is wheelchair accessible. Restroom is also clean.

Not sure able dine in and rooms services. So giving five starts.

text.text: This hotel is classified as a three star hotel but in reality the rooms are pathetic and are not even close to a three star hotel standard. Rooms have not been properly maintained and a lot of patch work can be seen in the rooms. Room cleanliness is terrible. Reception staff service as well is not good. Water bottles are not provided in the rooms unless you insist for them everyday from the reception.
